title: Global health experts sound alarm over RFK Jr., citing Samoa outbreak
content: Experts and officials said a 2019 measles outbreak in Samoa, which came after a visit by Kennedy, exemplified the dangers of his rhetoric.
summary: Experts and officials said a 2019 measles outbreak in Samoa, which came after a visit by Kennedy, exemplified the dangers of his rhetoric.

title: Israel drops massive bomb in Beirut strike, as Lebanon mulls cease-fire
content: Israel has stepped up strikes on the city’s southern suburbs in recent days, an area Israeli officials say hosts Hezbollah militants and infrastructure.
summary: Israel has stepped up strikes on the city’s southern suburbs in recent days, an area Israeli officials say hosts Hezbollah militants and infrastructure.

title: A baby red panda choked to death. Her vets blame fireworks.
content: Officials at the Edinburgh Zoo want lawmakers to ban pyrotechnics after concluding that they caused 3-month-old Roxie’s stress-induced vomiting.
summary: Officials at the Edinburgh Zoo want lawmakers to ban pyrotechnics after concluding that they caused 3-month-old Roxie’s stress-induced vomiting.

title: North Korea’s Kim Jong Un has never been more brazen — or in demand
content: Donald Trump says the North Korean leader ‘misses him.’ But Kim Jong Un has a new ally now in Russia’s Vladimir Putin, and that’s emboldening him like never before.
summary: Donald Trump says the North Korean leader ‘misses him.’ But Kim Jong Un has a new ally now in Russia’s Vladimir Putin, and that’s emboldening him like never before.

title: Trump taps Rubio for secretary of state. What are his foreign policy views?
content: Donald Trump said Sen. Marco Rubio of Florida will be secretary of state. Here’s where Rubio stands on the Israel-Gaza and Russia-Ukraine wars, NATO and more.
summary: Donald Trump said Sen. Marco Rubio of Florida will be secretary of state. Here’s where Rubio stands on the Israel-Gaza and Russia-Ukraine wars, NATO and more.

title: Gaza strikes kill at least 26, civil defense says
IDF sends enlistment notices to ultra-Orthodox Jews
content: Defense Minister Israel Katz gave the go-ahead for 7,000 draft notices to be sent to ultra-Orthodox Jews for enlistment in the Israel Defense Forces.
summary: Defense Minister Israel Katz gave the go-ahead for 7,000 draft notices to be sent to ultra-Orthodox Jews for enlistment in the Israel Defense Forces.

title: U.S.-equipped bomb hits edge of central Beirut amid cease-fire negotiations
Trump and the Israeli right resume their embrace
content: Right-wing Israelis have embraced fresh Trump appointees like Mike Huckabee and Elise Stefanik, foreshadowing a closer U.S.-Israeli relationship.
summary: Right-wing Israelis have embraced fresh Trump appointees like Mike Huckabee and Elise Stefanik, foreshadowing a closer U.S.-Israeli relationship.

title: Israel to issue military draft orders for ultra-Orthodox Jews
As Trump’s return to U.S. presidency nears, Iran debates its options
Beijing is already preparing to retaliate in a second Trump era
content: President-elect Donald Trump has vowed to impose new tariffs on China, but Beijing is wiser and better prepared to push back this time around, analysts say.
summary: President-elect Donald Trump has vowed to impose new tariffs on China, but Beijing is wiser and better prepared to push back this time around, analysts say.

title: New Zealanders are marching, performing haka to protest divisive bill
content: The Treaty Principles Bill seeks to revise New Zealand’s foundational agreement with Maori people and is hugely unpopular, with even the prime minister deriding it.
summary: The Treaty Principles Bill seeks to revise New Zealand’s foundational agreement with Maori people and is hugely unpopular, with even the prime minister deriding it.

title: Surge in worldwide measles cases driven by lack of vaccine coverage, WHO says
content: The WHO and CDC say there were about 10.3 million cases of measles last year, up 20 percent from 2022. Children are especially susceptible to complications.
summary: The WHO and CDC say there were about 10.3 million cases of measles last year, up 20 percent from 2022. Children are especially susceptible to complications.

title: Iranian student arrested in her underwear is latest symbol in fight for rights
content: Videos show the woman arguing with security forces in Tehran after removing some of her clothes in an apparent protest of the country’s Islamic dress code.
summary: Videos show the woman arguing with security forces in Tehran after removing some of her clothes in an apparent protest of the country’s Islamic dress code.

title: As Trump’s return to U.S. presidency nears, Iran debates its options
content: The Iranian mission to the United Nations declined to comment on a New York Times report that Trump ally Elon Musk met with Iran’s ambassador to the U.N.
summary: The Iranian mission to the United Nations declined to comment on a New York Times report that Trump ally Elon Musk met with Iran’s ambassador to the U.N.

title: IDF strikes Beirut suburbs for third day; Gaza safe zone hit
content: The Israel Defense Forces issued fresh evacuation alerts for Beirut’s suburbs, warning it intends to strike Hezbollah targets around the Lebanese capital.
summary: The Israel Defense Forces issued fresh evacuation alerts for Beirut’s suburbs, warning it intends to strike Hezbollah targets around the Lebanese capital.

title: China opens huge port in Peru to extend its reach in Latin America
content: The port opening in Chancay underscores China’s growing clout in a region that once looked primarily to the United States for economic opportunity.
summary: The port opening in Chancay underscores China’s growing clout in a region that once looked primarily to the United States for economic opportunity.

title: Tulsi Gabbard’s past comments on Russia cloud her nomination by Trump
content: Gabbard was named Wednesday by President-elect Donald Trump as his pick for director of national intelligence.
summary: Gabbard was named Wednesday by President-elect Donald Trump as his pick for director of national intelligence.

title: Argentina’s president considers exiting Paris agreement with Trump
content: Right-wing President Javier Milei is considering withdrawing Argentina from the Paris climate agreement. Donald Trump has pledged to also remove the United States.
summary: Right-wing President Javier Milei is considering withdrawing Argentina from the Paris climate agreement. Donald Trump has pledged to also remove the United States.

title: Russia pushes forward in Ukraine amid talk of negotiations
content: A buildup of Russian troops in Ukraine’s southeast comes as uncertainty looms over how a Trump presidency will affect the war.
summary: A buildup of Russian troops in Ukraine’s southeast comes as uncertainty looms over how a Trump presidency will affect the war.

title: Hospitals are running out of food as strikes continue in Gaza’s besieged north
Bombings in Brazil’s capital revive fears over fate of democracy
content: A man whom police called a political malcontent set off several explosions in Brasília on Wednesday evening.
summary: A man whom police called a political malcontent set off several explosions in Brasília on Wednesday evening.

title: Israeli forces hit Beirut suburbs for third consecutive day
Trump set to deepen tech Cold War with China
content: The containment policy set in the first Trump administration and continued under President Biden will get a harder edge, former officials say.
summary: The containment policy set in the first Trump administration and continued under President Biden will get a harder edge, former officials say.

title: Israel accused of war crimes and crimes against humanity by rights group
